main event: Witnesses reported sightings of unidentified flying objects in Van Nuys, California on May 6, 1955.
interesting points: Two witnesses described the object as circular and bright white in color, both witnessing it making abrupt turns,The objects were observed flying at high speeds and rolling in flight,One report noted that the object hovered silently before accelerating rapidly,Another account mentions the object being approximately 75 feet in diameter,Multiple evaluations concluded that the observed objects were likely aircraft, but they were not identifiable.
witness description: George L. Saulish, Jerry L. Gagnon, and Capt. W.E. McCartt
